channel.title: Family issues
channel.description: Ok, well my family is soo loveing irritating, my brothers thing they are all that and always piss me off just because they are the favorites in the house, my mom and dad don't give a shit and when i ignore them all my parents ground me for being "ignorant"

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Like I and RSCShadow suggested, run away.[/thread]

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Well I (assume) that one of those three brothers would be driving the get away vehicle? ~!^ so one would still be loose.

Are you so sure about that? When you hit a dog with a newspaper does that make the dog be fearful? Or does it teach him not to take a crap on the carpet? If you enforce the discipline by explaining what was done wrong then it gives a stingnitism(misspelled I know…) so they understand not to do it again, and motivation to not do it again.

OT: I still stand by my original topic. Being mad at your family/siblings isn’t going to change. You will be mad at them for many years to come even as adults you can get mad at siblings and your other relatives. The logical thing to do is to talk it over with them either individually or as a group. “family meeting?”

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Loveandpower:

[quote]Did you not see the 3 girls who were kidnapped while doing things such as going to school?

Sadly, stuff like that is why I don’t watch the news any longer. As far as “what did they do” I doubt there was a group of three plus men who attacked them to abduct them therefore at least one of them could had run/screamed/whatever.[/quote]

3 brothers were in this if I’m not mistaken, so you would be wrong on that.

Oh and getting hit isn’t discipline, it’s fear. If you get hit (I’m going to assume switching is slang for hit) you don’t make the connection with doing something bad and there being a consequence for it, you become afraid that if you don’t do what they want, then someone will hit you.

OT: you say that it pisses you off because they think they are the favorites. This can mean a multitude of things, so if you can clarify what exactly happens then I think we can tell you what you might want to try that will help your situation.

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Because thats what people told us to do and we dont want to break the cycle just yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Did you not see the 3 girls who were kidnapped while doing things such as going to school?

Sadly, stuff like that is why I don’t watch the news any longer. As far as “what did they do” I doubt there was a group of three plus men who attacked them to abduct them therefore at least one of them could had run/screamed/whatever.

You just can’t use an example of something you see on the news as an example of life and the stories thereof. If you have never thought about leaving home well all I can say to that is you must had been an only child.

I can relate to the OP. Why? I have two older brothers and two younger sisters. The eldest sister gets on my nerves all the time, but I know how she feels exactly cause I take care of both of them now financially. Don’t even try to talk to me like it is uncommon for people to run away. i could link you to more than one famous site where ti discusses the reasoning why children decide to “run away”.

I don’t support it, I don’t like it, and I don’t suggest it coming from somebody guess what who actually did for a VERY short time.

Maybe you got into a fight with a sibling, maybe you got mad at mom and dad when they punished you. Where I grew up though you did as you were told, when you were told or you got told to turn around and get a switching like you never seen.

See that’s the difference in us you haven’t seen real discipline quite frankly.

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

I didn’t say it was a rare occurrence, I merely said it is ignorant to state that EVERYONE runs away. Also, thinking and doing are two different things. However no I have not thought about running away or threatened it.

Your ignorance is yet again shown by thinking that just because someone struggles means they can get away. Did you not see the 3 girls who were kidnapped while doing things such as going to school? I sincerely doubt that all three of them said “welp, guess I’ll just go along with this!” That’s called blaming the victim. Don’t be that guy.

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Elrick:

I didn’t, your statement is false. Those two statements are some of the most ignorant things I have ever read on the internet, as I hope you realize that is the prime time for rapists and kidnappers to idk… take them away from where they started? How about we not mention things that can cause someone to potentially have their lives ruined. And yes you did, you implied it was a natural thing to do.

Sadly I think you are the misconceived person here…

Sadly from what I see you are 22 so you should even know this. Back when we were younger we didn’t worry about going outside and some rapist or kidnapper abducting us and still shouldn’t. Showing fear is being just as liable as as letting the person abduct you in the first place cause that’s what motivates them to do it they want to see that fear. If you get kidnapped or touched by somebody you don’t want/need touching you do one of two things

  1. kick, scream, punch, whatever it takes to get away
  2. run away and get help

it’s quite simple really so let’s not even go into environmental safety topic with me.

[hr]

Are you trying to tell me that you have NEVER threatened to run away, had a smidgen of a thought to run away, ever ran away? I’m sorry but I am not about to take taht for anything. It doesn’t even have to be “running away” if you think your life could be affected in a more positive way in a different atmosphere then guess what you just thought about a life in another way somehow then with your family.

Children DO run away on a daily basis whether or not you wish to believe it. Half the crap you see on TV is just misinformed reporters. Why? Did anybody see that eight year old abducted? No, funny cause he came home 48 hours later but of course the news didn’t say anything/report on that now did they? Why? Because it makes them look stupid.

Stop believing everything you see on TV and live what little life yous till have left.

Read full topic

I didn’t, your statement is false. How about we not mention things that can cause someone to potentially have their lives ruined. And yes you did, you implied it was a natural thing to do.

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I never said that I encouraged him to “run away” I am just stating a prety well known fact that everyone runs away at one point or another for 1-2 days. They always end up where they started as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:19, topic:518398”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=636662.msg4295075#msg4295075 date=1368067062]

[quote author=Tree link=topic=636662.msg4295049#msg4295049 date=1368064344]
Grow up.
[/quote]dude hes only 12 go easy on him okay -_-
[/quote]I think most young males run away at least once anyway to just blow steam off then they come back.[/quote]
So we’re encouraging people to do stupid shit because everyone else is doing it? Hey kids are doing cocaine, let’s all just do it because some do? That is stupid logic.

Talk to your parents, away from your brothers, if you think it will help. Say what you’re feeling and see how they react. If they blow it off and say they don’t do that, then wait until they do it again and say see this is what I’m talking about. If they’re decent parents they’ll realize they are being ass holes and will cool down.

Everyone acts like they can’t stand their parents just because they’re in a specific age group. It’s stereotypes like this that burn bridges and ruin relationships where it isn’t necessary. Obviously all family situations are not the same and some parents are just ass holes, but you can’t complain about how much your life sucks until you try to fix it.

Also, why the hell does everyone instantly go to “Suck it up”, “Punch him in the face”, and “drugs” whenever someone asks how to approach a situation in here? They’re probably not going to you guys to see how much you can troll them or how to do something in the least tactful way possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

RSCShadow:

Run away.

I ran away from home when I was only eleven years old and I must say, it was probably one of the best experiences in my life. I have never looked back since. My entire family was mistreating me in horrible ways, putting me down every day, physically abusing me, the whole nine yards.

Today, I live on my own, I haven’t spoken or seen my family since that fateful day when I was eleven. I now have a full time job making over $50,000 a year, at the age of 21.

Life is great, don’t let other people drag you down.

Read full topic

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:5, topic:518398”]No, that’s ignorant!

Not sure if trolling or attention seeking.

You think you have it bad, everyone had family issues. It isn’t like you have the worst family, and you don’t have the best either. Just deal with it until you’re old enough to move out.[/quote]
Thanks for the advice. I know that i don’t have it the worst.

^ or do what i did and say you’ll fail all your exams on purpose if they don’t fix up! *worked like a charm

item.title: Family issues
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:5, topic:518398”]No, that’s ignorant!

Not sure if trolling or attention seeking.

You think you have it bad, everyone had family issues. It isn’t like you have the worst family, and you don’t have the best either. Just deal with it until you’re old enough to move out.[/quote]
Pretty much this. I’ve got parents that don’t care about me. I can walk out the door of my house and be gone for a week and they don’t even notice. I know because I’ve done it in the past. If you’re brothers piss you off. Just punch them in the face. If you’re too weak against them start working out here and there.
But seriously, people have it worse. I keep that in my head at all times.

Read full topic
